RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 53. Claiming Purse 12000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 20 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SING A LULLABYE took an immediate lead while tapering to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure past the five sixteenths pole and rounded the turn at the rail, was steadily handled to late stretch then taken in hand approaching the wire. ELLIES AT WINDSOR was jostled at the break but closed to contention and gave chase through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and dug in through the stretch to hold second. LIL BUNNY gave chase, raced three wide on the turn and was gaining on second every stride. IMINCHARGENOW chased through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn then flattened in the lane. AWESOME MOON came in and made contact with Ellies At Windsor leaving the gate, chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn two deep while between horses and showed little in the lane. JUJU ON DA BEAT chased outside, raced in the five path on the turn and showed little in the stretch. LET'S DO THIS came out and made contact with Ellies At Windsor then gave chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Ellies At Windsor
ENTRY.COMMENT: jostled break,up to contention,chased,rail turn,held on 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Iminchargenow
ENTRY.OWNER: Ali Andrew and Schottroffe Edward T

ENTRY.NAME: Sing a Lullabye
ENTRY.COMMENT: immediate lead,rated pace inside,pressured 5/16,in hand late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAMA MARGE exchanged contact with Somesugarnspice leaving the gate then pressured the early pace, took over past the three eighths and drew away toward the quarter pole, raced at the rail and was kept alert through the stretch. DIRECT THE CAT exchanged contact with Shewonttalktome leaving the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn in the four path, was carried out approaching the head of the lane, but dug in from that point to clear second late stretch. NAVY BAND broke sharply and set a pressured early pace, gave chase past the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the turn but drifted toward the head of the lane and relented second later yards. HONESTLY OLIN'S bobbled and made contact with Shewonttalktome after the start and pressured the early pace, dropped back past the three eighths, rounded the turn near the rail then flattened inside the eighth pole. SHEWONTTALKTOME exchanged contact with Direct The Cat leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the five path and showed little more. FULL OF CHARM gave chase inside, raced near the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. YES TO LOVE gave chase while saving ground. MISS INTENSITY chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path and weakened. SOMESUGARNSPICE was jostled leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and weakened. ANOTHER FINE JUBA broke through prior the start, came in at the break and made contact with Somesugarnspice and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Mama Marge
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Contreras Javier
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,up past 3/8,rated pace,drew away turn,kept alert

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 18500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 20 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8, 000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PURE NONSENSE took the lead leaving the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, raced off the rail on the turn and dug in to a clear advantage inside the sixteenth pole. DIVA ROSE pressured the pace inside, raced at the rail on the turn and remained a factor through the upper stretch, but dropped back a sixteenth away and flattened late yards. REAL APPEAL chased, rounded the turn near the rail and ran evenly in the lane. PEARLY GHOST chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and passed rivals in the lane. SIENTE LA BRISA gave close early chase, raced in the three path on the turn and flattened in the lane. FIFTY GRAY SHADES stumbled at the break, gave close early chase but weakened in the six path on the turn. WISHING FOR SPRING became fractious in the gate then ducked out at the start, chased outside, raced in the four and five paths on the turn and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Pure Nonsense
ENTRY.COMMENT: up past 1/2,set pressured pace,off rail turn,cleared inside 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Pearly Ghost
ENTRY.OWNER: Mountain View Racing LLC and Golden Melinda B

ENTRY.NAME: Wishing for Spring
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious in gate,ducked out start,chased,4& 5p turn,weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Maiden Claiming Purse 18500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WICKED SAUCY took the lead leaving the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, was urged away at the rail on the far turn, kept alert through the upper stretch then only hand ridden the final sixteenth. MARQUET CLASSIC bobbled and made contact with RAINBOW RHYTHM leaving the gate then stalked, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and was no match in the lane. The latter was bumped leaving the gate then rated close inside, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and ran evenly in the lane. NELLY TOO raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and showed little in the lane. SUPER SWEETIE raced wide throughout then bore further outward on the far turn. SUPER WICKED lunged from the gate and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Nelly Too
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail 1st turn,chased 3/8,3p far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Super Sweetie
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5p 1st turn,wide throughout, bore out far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Saucy
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,urged away rail turn,hand ridden 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 14100. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 20, 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 20 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WIDGET FACTORY contested the pace through the backstretch and dueled at even terms two deep on the turn, took the nod toward mid-stretch, raced briefly clear then held on. NO FOOLING DUDE chased through the backstretch, raced close in the three path on the turn and finished well at the outside girth of the winner. BE BE BOP came away awkwardly and contested a pressured pace, dueled at even terms at the rail on the turn, gave up the nod mid-stretch then flattened later yards. BARRY KARAFIN BETS ducked out and made contact with Aw Ite leaving the gate then gave chase inside, raced near the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. WIZARD OF ODDS gave chase toward the inside, rounded the turn at the rail, eased out leaving the turn and ran evenly in the lane. AWESUMMER chased outside, was forced wider mid turn and showed little in the stretch. BUCKED TOOTH broke a step slow, was shut off and was slow getting into stride then saved ground. AW ITE was bumped out leaving the gate then gave chase, checked from a narrowing opening past the five sixteenths pole, angled to the six path on the turn, was carried wide toward the head of the lane and weakened. HELL'S KITTEN was not a factor. STARSHIP TAXI chased toward mid track, was checked while bearing out midway on the turn, pulled up lame and was vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Barry Karafin Bets
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out,bumped break,chased inside,rail turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Aw Ite
ENTRY.OWNER: Inman Betty Tunstall Shirley and Tunstall James

ENTRY.NAME: Bucked Tooth
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow,shut off break,slow into stride,saved ground

ENTRY.NAME: Be Be Bop
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break,contested pace,even terms rail turn,flattened late

ENTRY.NAME: Starship Taxi
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased mid track,checked,bore out mid turn,eased,vanned off lame

ENTRY.NAME: Widget Factory
ENTRY.COMMENT: contested pace,even terms 2d turn,nod near 1/16,held on

ENTRY.NAME: Awesummer
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside,forced wide mid turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: No Fooling Dude
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Conrad Randall R

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REVEREND JACK raced well off the early pace about the four path, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole and improved steadily, raced at the rail on the far turn, dug in for the lead nearing mid-stretch and edged clear later yards. SUMMONING DENIS rated close off the rail on the opening turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, raced at even terms in the four path midway on the far turn then dueled through the stretch for second. JUST CALL ME AL rounded the opening turn about the five path, challenged toward the three eighths pole and contested even terms between horses on the far turn, was met toward mid-stretch then outfinished in the duel for second. GAMBLING FEVER exchanged contact with Jooby Dooby Doo leaving the gate but took a quick lead and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, was met a the rail past the quarter and weakened inside the eighth. SCARE DEM saved ground on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths, raced off the rail on the far turn and showed little further. LAST PARTY ducked out and made contact with CHICKERLING leaving the gate then rated just off the pace inside, gave chase toward the three eighths pole but faded on the far turn. The latter was bumped leaving the gate and steadied off the heels of rivals into the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and closed ground through the backstretch, but weakened in the four path on the far turn. BAD LINEAGE raced off the rail on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. JOOBY DOOBY DOO exchanged contact with Gambling Fever leaving the gate, rounded the first turn about the three path then faded past the three eighths pole. DON'T GET CAUGHTUP rounded the first turn about the five path and showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Last Party
ENTRY.OWNER: Don't Chasem Replacem Racing and Armstrong Katina M

ENTRY.NAME: Gambling Fever
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Scare Dem
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Reverend Jack
ENTRY.OWNER: Hasty Rebel Stables LLC and Carlisle Horse Company
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 4p,bid 3/8,rail turn,dug in lane,up near 1/16,clear

ENTRY.NAME: Summoning Denis
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close off rail,chased 3/8,even terms 4p turn,drift,duel 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 94. Allowance Purse 34800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 20 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 20 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THE SKY IS FALLING dropped back from early contention and settled inside on the first turn, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path but eased to the outside entering the stretch, dug in for the lead in later yards and drew clear approaching the wire. CHANGE THE WORLD settled inside then picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail, was outfinished in the duel through the stretch but took second in the final yards. LUCYLOU WHO moved to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure passing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and dug in under steady encouragement leaving the turn, but was caught while flattening stride later yards. MOONLIT SHADOW stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, raced in range of the lead in the four path on the far turn but flattened stride inside the sixteenth pole. JAMESTOWN ROAD raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but faded into the far turn. REVEIRS MINUTE stalked two deep on the first turn, challenged approaching the three eighths pole but faded past the pole.

ENTRY.NAME: The Sky Is Falling
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside,bid 3/8,3p far turn,up later yards,clear near wire

ENTRY.NAME: Lucylou Who
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,caught later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 58. Claiming Purse 12500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Co nsidered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CEDARS BULLS EYE settled off the pace about the four path, improved her position leaving the half mile pole and bid toward the three eighths, took over in the three path at the quarter pole, raced clear midway on the far turn and was steadily handled through the lane. HOW IS SHE raced well off the pace and off the rail, bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole, improved six wide on the far turn and dug in to take second later yards. HERETODAYGONMANANA reared leaving the gate then saved ground well off the pace, started a bid at the nine sixteenths pole, steadily improved and raced close in the four path of the far turn, but drifted into the lane and flattened stride inside the sixteenth pole. MY SISTER PAM settled in the three and four paths then saved ground on the second turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn but flattened the final sixteenth. FORT ZANNA raced off the rail early on, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path then flattened in the stretch. PRETTY SPECTACULAR took the lead and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, was met at the rail at the quarter pole, continued close through the far turn but weakened into the lane. TAPPING SOUTH raced well off the early pace about the four path, left the second turn outside and picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole but weakened in the seven path on the far turn. TIZBIT rated close to the early pace inside, started a three wide bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened in the three path of the far turn. GOLDEN SALLY stalked the early pace, picked up the chase into the backstretch but faded leaving the three eighths pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Tizbit
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,3wd bid 7/16,weakened 3p far turn

ENTRY.NAME: How Is She
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 7/16,6p far turn,up 2nd later yards

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Timothy C. Grams & Judith A Grams
